meta.Title: HAPPY NEWS YEAR! [New York Times, Sunday, January 2, 1944]
meta.Author: Louis Baron

across.question: Japanese island group in the Pacific.
Site of notorious Nazi concentration camp.
Day breeze on Lake Garda, Italy.
Seat of important Allied oil fields.
American operatic soprano born in Leipzig.
Extinct South African antelope, the blaubok.
Largest island of Japan, capital Tokyo.
German sociopolitical philosopher, whose writings greatly influenced Hitler.
Crystalline compound of apiol and sodium ethylate.
One of the Fascisti in Mussolini's day.
American philanthropist, home now a museum in NY.
J. P. Morgan yacht, now serving in Navy.
Bed of shell and limestone deposits.
U. S. bomber base, bay in New Guinea.
Name added to ordinary name and surname.
Pertaining to the large forearm bone.

down.question: Eldest son of Rebecca and Isaac.
Axis commander in action on Russian front.
Father of Hermia in "Midsummer Night's Dream."
Advocate of restoration of royalty in Europe.
"As ___ as life and twice as natural."—Carroll.
Ether compound derived from an oxygenated acid.
Famous U. S. aircraft carrier, saw action in Pacific arena.
In Greek religion, an avenging spirit: Var.
Home of the philosophers Parmenides and Zeno.
Petty officer in U. S. Navy.
Scene of vivid action in African campaign.
Lumps of mineralized vegetable matter fuel.
An Allied objective in New Guinea.
